newsitem.title: SRI LANKA: PRESS DIGEST - Sri Lanka Newspapers - February 19.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Sri Lanka Newspapers - February 19.

text.p: These are the leading stories in the Sri Lankan press on Wednesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
Government forces reach Madhu junction in advance into Tamil Tiger rebel territory in northwestern Mannar region but meet little resistance.
Government hands over 100,000 "linerooms" to workers in 500 estates.
Two police bodyguards of absconding opposition lawmaker, Susantha Punchinilame, surrender with their weapons. Punchinilame is wanted over the killing of ruling coalition lawmaker Nalanda Ellawala.
Police Criminal Investigation Department deploys special team of detectives to trace weapons used in killing of ruling coalition lawmaker Nalanda Ellawala.

President Chandrika Kumaratunga ordered immediate transfer of 150 policemen in Ratnapura district on request made by district's ruling coalition lawmakers. Coalition MPs were concerned over police inaction in investigation into killing of ruling coalition lawmaker Nalanda Ellawala.
